metadata.name: A walking geisha #25
metadata.description:
Girls don't like to be alone in the way they travel
Be with them on the journey

metadata.name: Morixels Colab #5 Gango #119
metadata.description:
The Gango collection was created from famous western symbols so that the whole world knows it.
In this collection, you can see a combination of unrelated but beautiful components.

Try your luck to have a more beautiful combination

The Gango is unique random Generated 200 PFP NFTs. The number of Traits in this collection is 9 (72 layers) and it has the ability to make unique 74,027,520 NFTs.

To create balance, these NFTs are randomly minted, and this is a chance for everyone to get a rare version. So due to the low price of these NFTs, if the rare version did not belong to you, it is still possible for you to mint the new NFTs.

Because this is an NFT in PFP format, you can put it on your avatar on Twitter or Instagram.

This project is a collaboration project and it is a Benefit for the owners of most Morixels Mans to Collaborate with Morixels Designer.

You can read more information on Morixels website 👇

Website: https://morixels.com/

Twitter: @Morixels

by: @morteza_yousefy & @mahdirezafathi

Made in 2022

metadata.name: Alternative view #173
metadata.description: Just code. Made with p5.js

metadata.name: A Strange Loop #325
metadata.description:
[ TAP/CLICK TO ACTIVATE SOUND ]

A whiff of pattern begins to emerge. Out of disarray comes the familiar pulsation of an ordered signal. The sense of regularity strengthens and we feel it swelling towards a singularity. Heeere weeee goooo… BAM! Then off again marching back into chaos to repeat the cycle.

Proposed by cognitive scientist Douglas Hofstadter in his 1979 book “Gödel, Escher, Bach”, and further developed in his 2007 book “I Am a Strange Loop”, “Strange Loops” are Hofstadter’s attempt at explaining the mechanisms that give rise to the sensation of “I” - through hierarchical, self-referential, and at times seemingly paradoxical feedback-loops of abstraction and causality. 

—

“Who shoves whom around in the tangled megaganglion that is your brain, and who shoves whom around in ‘this teetering bulb of dread and dream’ that is mine?”

“Do dreads and dreams, hopes and griefs, ideas and beliefs, interests and doubts, infatuations and envies, memories and ambitions, bouts of nostalgia and floods of empathy, flashes of guilt and sparks of genius, play any role in the world of physical objects? Do such pure abstractions have causal powers? Can they shove massive things around, or are they just impotent fictions?” 

"In the end, we are self-perceiving, self-inventing, locked-in mirages that are little miracles of self-reference. [...] Poised midway between the unvisualizable cosmic vastness of curved spacetime and the dubious, shadowy flickerings of charged quanta, we human beings, more like rainbows and mirages than like raindrops or boulders, are unpredictable self-writing poems — vague, metaphorical, ambiguous, and sometimes exceedingly beautiful.”

- Douglas Hofstadter, “I Am a Strange Loop”, 2007

–-

Memo Akten 
ƈօʍքʊtǟtɨօռǟʟ Aʀȶɨֆȶ; AI wrangler; curious philomath; PhD in Creative Artificial Intelligence with Meaningful Human Control; works with code to create images, sounds, films, large-scale responsive installations and performances; fascinated by trying to understand the nature of nature and the human condition.

James Paterson 
Synthesizing drawing, animation, sculpture and code under the moniker Presstube since 1999. Inspired by meditation, molecular biology, music, parenting, psychedelics, the seen, the heard, the felt, the cognized.

–-

Controls:
- CLICK/TAP ONCE ON THE SCREEN TO ACTIVATE SOUND
- ‘S’: to toggle Sound on/off (only works when opened fullscreen)

metadata.name: NO ROADMAP #14
metadata.description:
This collection represents the need we have to move forward despite the obstacles that the road may present us.
We identify ourselves with the one who, even without the most optimal conditions, continues on its way until the goal is reached
Web 3.0 is a space that appears to us without a roadmap, so that everyone can explore it and learn.
Even though we only get to have a skateboard, in this journey of work and effort, we will continue asking ourselves until we can at last get it
WEN LAMBO?

+ 100 Roaders + Color variations
+ 50 Backgrounds + Color variations
+ 30 Foreground
+ 50 Animals
+ 25 Foreground elements
+ 10 Police cars on fire

metadata.name: Match and Connect #44
metadata.description:
Connect side by side object with matching shape or color inside a grid system.

one line one color for matching color
one line with two colors for matching shape
three line for matching shape and color

Variations:
13 palettes;
Earthquake mode; (rare)
Change size mode; (rare)
Just stroke mode; (rare)
Frame mode; (rare)

created using p5js

metadata.name: Alternative view #150
metadata.description: Just code. Made with p5.js

metadata.name: A walking geisha #19
metadata.description:
Girls don't like to be alone in the way they travel
Be with them on the journey

metadata.name: PIPES #147
metadata.description:
PIPES are its own creatures growing out of an Octree, swirling and twirling towards each's individual destination.  

Features:   
  There are four different flow modes, seven different palettes.   
  PIPES can either be hollow or filled, and there is a small chance the PIPES is drawn in gradient.  

Loading time is about 6s and then it will start to animate. Thank you for your patience.  

Press 'S' to save a high resolution 4800x4800px PNG of the artwork.  

This work is made purely with p5js.

A whiff of pattern begins to emerge. Out of disarray comes the familiar pulsation of an ordered signal. The sense of regularity strengthens and we feel it swelling towards a singularity. Heeere weeee goooo… BAM! Then off again marching back into chaos to repeat the cycle.

Proposed by cognitive scientist Douglas Hofstadter in his 1979 book “Gödel, Escher, Bach”, and further developed in his 2007 book “I Am a Strange Loop”, “Strange Loops” are Hofstadter’s attempt at explaining the mechanisms that give rise to the sensation of “I” - through hierarchical, self-referential, and at times seemingly paradoxical feedback-loops of abstraction and causality. 

—

“Who shoves whom around in the tangled megaganglion that is your brain, and who shoves whom around in ‘this teetering bulb of dread and dream’ that is mine?”

“Do dreads and dreams, hopes and griefs, ideas and beliefs, interests and doubts, infatuations and envies, memories and ambitions, bouts of nostalgia and floods of empathy, flashes of guilt and sparks of genius, play any role in the world of physical objects? Do such pure abstractions have causal powers? Can they shove massive things around, or are they just impotent fictions?” 

"In the end, we are self-perceiving, self-inventing, locked-in mirages that are little miracles of self-reference. [...] Poised midway between the unvisualizable cosmic vastness of curved spacetime and the dubious, shadowy flickerings of charged quanta, we human beings, more like rainbows and mirages than like raindrops or boulders, are unpredictable self-writing poems — vague, metaphorical, ambiguous, and sometimes exceedingly beautiful.”

- Douglas Hofstadter, “I Am a Strange Loop”, 2007

James Paterson 
Synthesizing drawing, animation, sculpture and code under the moniker Presstube since 1999. Inspired by meditation, molecular biology, music, parenting, psychedelics, the seen, the heard, the felt, the cognized.
